name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: OHSCP, PHSCP, PCMP, EMP, ECP, CEMP, ERA, QMP, CHMP, SWMS
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material intended for use is to be submitted to the client prior to placement to verify it conforms to required specifications.

○ Materials used for rock beaching shall be resistant to weathering action of air, wind and water and shall be free from staining, laminations, cracks and other structural defects which may reduce its mechanical strength.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all beaching locations are to be confirmed with the superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas on which beaching is to be placed shall be compacted and trimmed as required to provide a finished surface level of beaching in accordance with the drawings.
○ Any scours or hollows in the surface shall be filled with compacted Class 4 crushed rock.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Type 1 beaching shall not routinely require a granular bedding, however a very robust needle-punched non woven geotextile (mass >250 g/m2) shall be laid over the trimmed surface where rock beaching is to be placed.
○ The geotextile shall be laid evenly with no kinks or folds, and joints shall be formed by overlapping the geotextile by not less than 300 mm and not more than 500 mm.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Geotextiles used shall comply with and be placed in accordance with Section 210. The geotextile shall be buried to a depth of 300 mm at the edges of beaching and placed under and around the excavation for the toe wall and for any other perimeter walls provided.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rock for Type 1 beaching shall consist of field or quarry rock.
○ All rocks shall have a mass of between 20 and 70 kg and at least 60% by number shall be over 40 kg. Rocks shall be of such size that the layer of beaching is not less than 225 mm thick
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Beaching materials shall be firmly bedded on the prepared embankment and/or bedding if required and laid in courses commencing from the bottom of any slope.
○ Un-grouted beaching and armour stone when placed shall form a tight ‘interlocking grid’, which shall prevent the removal of individual rocks.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Finished surface levels of rock beaching placed in open drains shall be flush with adjacent soil levels to allow mowing and maintenance.
○ Rock beaching shall not protrude more than 50 mm above the surrounding ground levels.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The finished surface of the beaching shall conform to the levels, lines and grades as shown on the drawings or as specified.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
